intro: Paronychia kapela, commonly known as the Cape paronychia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Paronychia kapela is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
